Owls¶

An owl is an entity responsible for handling messages of its kind (SMS, email etc). Each owl defines a set of message handlers with a templates that can be used to along with associated parameters to send a message.

Messages are mostly handled asynchronously. That means as you call one of the handler, message is composed and stored in database for some independent process to pick up and dispatch it.

Guidelines:
  • For every communication kind (SMS, email) an owl class is created.
  • Inside this class, methods are defined that actually compose a message given a set of parameters, create database entries and return its instance. An example can be a handler to send message for registration verification or success. Any error or failure occurred must be thrown as an exception.
  • These handler methods may or may not send message immediately and mostly rely on some independent process to send them.
class owlery.owls.EmailOwl¶

Owl to handle all emails. This class defines various email template that can used to send email. All methods composes email according to the parameters and store them in owlery.models.EmailMessage from where they are picked up by a cron process for dispatching.

Authors: Gagandeep Singh

static send_brand_change_request(change_req, requester)¶

Sends an email to all brand owners about the change request.

Parameters:
  • change_req – Request instance brands.models.BrandChangeRequest
  • requester – Registered user that requested the change.
Returns:

Returns List<owlery.model.EmailMessage instance> of those owners who had email address.

Authors: Gagandeep Singh

Returns:Returns List<owlery.model.EmailMessage instance> of those owners who had email address.

static send_brand_disassociation_success(user, brand)¶

Sends confirmation email to user’ disassociation from a brand.

Parameters:
  • user – User instance to whom email is to be send
  • brand – brands.models.Brand model instance
Returns:

Returns owlery.model.EmailMessage instance if email address was present else None

Note

Email is send immediately.

Authors: Gagandeep Singh

  • reg_user_disass – Registered user instance that left the brand

static send_password_reset(email_address, user_token, username=None)¶

Sends a ‘password reset/recovery’ email containing verification code.

Parameters:
  • email_address – Email address of the receiver
  • user_token – Instance of accounts.models.UserToken containing the code.
  • username – (Optional) Username of user to which SMS is to be send.
Returns:

Returns owlery.model.EmailMessage instance.

Authors: Gagandeep Singh

class owlery.owls.NotificationOwl¶

Owl to handle all notification that can be send in an asynchronous manner to all devices (mobile or web) of a user.

Following is the complete notification workflow:

  1. Call any of the defined handler methods with required parameters.
  2. The method uses parameters to compose a message and creates database entry.
  3. An independent process running periodically picks up this message as per its priority and sends the message to push service.

Authors: Gagandeep Singh

Parameters:

class owlery.owls.SmsOwl¶

Owl to handle all sms. This class defines various SMS templates that can be send in an asynchronous manner.

Following is the complete SMS workflow:

  1. Call any of the defined handler methods with required parameters.
  2. The method uses parameters to compose a message and creates database entry.
  3. An independent process running periodically picks up this message as per its priority and sends the message.

Authors: Gagandeep Singh

static send_brand_change_request(change_req, requester)¶

Sends brand change request message to all owners of the brand.

Parameters:
  • change_req – Request instance brands.models.BrandChangeRequest
  • requester – Registered user that requested the change.
Returns:

List<owlery.model.SmsMessage>

static send_brand_disassociation_success(mobile_no, brand, username=None)¶

Sends a SMS confirmation to the user about his disassociation from the brand.

Parameters:
  • mobile_no – Mobile number. +91-9999999999 is converted to +919999999999
  • brand – brands.models.Brand model instance
  • username – (Optional) Username of user to which SMS is to be send.
Returns:

Returns owlery.model.SmsMessage instance.

Authors: Gagandeep Singh

static send_password_reset(mobile_no, user_token, username=None)¶

Sends a ‘password reset/recovery’ SMS containing verification code.

Parameters:
  • mobile_no – Mobile number. +91-9999999999 is converted to +919999999999
  • user_token – Instance of accounts.models.UserToken containing the code.
  • username – (Optional) Username of user to which SMS is to be send.
Returns:

Returns owlery.model.SmsMessage instance.

Authors: Gagandeep Singh

static send_reg_verification(mobile_no, user_token, username=None)¶

Sends a ‘registration verification’ SMS containing verification code.

Parameters:
  • mobile_no – Mobile number. +91-9999999999 is converted to +919999999999
  • user_token – Instance of accounts.models.UserToken containing the code.
  • username – (Optional) Username of user to which SMS is to be send.
Returns:

Returns owlery.model.SmsMessage instance.
